name: Urquhart Caledonian Hotel

reviews.text: I booked this hotel after reading tripadvisor.co.uk reviews and was grateful to find the good reviews were all true! I travelled with my boyfriend and parents, away for a long weekend for my parents birthdays so hoped that everyone would be happy with my choice of accommodation. It's a family run hotel with an extremely warm welcome and the staff were all very freindly and helpful, full of tips on the best bits of Skye to see before we headed off the island. The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable, tasty breakfasts and good value meals in the bar. Located off the main square, right in the heart of Portree, it's a great location for exploring the town & the island.
reviews.title: Great place with friendly, helpful staff

reviews.text: The seal of approval came from my mum, who is a little bit hard to please, who loved the place and will probably recommend it to everyone she speaks to! :)
reviews.title: Would not return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked for one night based on tripadvisor reviews. Room was very disappointing. Carpet was stained and grubby. Insufficient towels for the 3 of us, bed very uncomfortable. Breakfast was very average, Overall impression of hotel was not good. However, I would agree with other comments made, that all the staff we encountered were very friendly.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorry but will not be back.
reviews.title: Great Scottish Hospitality!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on here and were really pleased with the experience. We were cheerfully checked in late in the evening. All of the staff were very friendly. The room was nice and clean with a view of the water. The breakfast was good and the location was great for seeing quite a bit of the Isle of Skye. If we make it back to Portee again, we will definitely stay here.
reviews.title: Those awesome persons at the Caledonian saved me from my troubles!

likes.disliked: — Going up a staircase with a heavy backpack (that's the only thing I can come up with, everything was great really).

reviews.title: Great finish to the holiday weekend
reviews.text: Been here several times with friends and always look forward to it because I know what I'm going to get. Have never logged a review as there's been nothing wrong but that doesn't let you know about what you're missing!

reviews.title: Simply the best
reviews.text: I've been picky with my star ratings as all 'fives' would lose effect. The location is very central which suits me but maybe not others. The private car park is small and a bit hidden away but there's a public carpark nearby.

reviews.title: Friendly, Helpful Staff Make it Special
reviews.text: Very nice rooms with great showers that take the pain away.

reviews.title: great family run hotel
reviews.text: The sleep quality rating was reduced solely due to the snoring volume of my room mate!

reviews.title: Great Weekend
reviews.text: Service from the staff is great, polite and helpful at the beginning and then plenty of banter once they know you can handle it......

reviews.title: Just the job
reviews.text: This is a no frills hotel in a great location right in the centre of Portree. What made it stand out for us were the friendly staff, good breakfasts and the fact that everything was spotless. Our room was pretty standard with a hard (but compfortable) bed and a good shower. Reception is on the second floor up two narrow flights of stairs, although there is direct access to this floor from the car park at the back. On the ground floor is a super little cafe (the food is much better than average cafe fare) and a basic, modern bar is on the floor above. Bedrooms are on the second and third floors and with no lifts guests with limited mobility might struggle. Overall, however, this place does its job very well indeed.

reviews.title: Good solid hotel
reviews.text: In general I liked my one night stay here. Was not my first choice as I had tried a few other places before getting two rooms here. Rack rate is 80GBP p/n including breakfast.

reviews.title: Perfect location, great little hotel!
reviews.text: We had parked on the main street and were not aware that there was an entrance around the back which leads to the reception. Perhaps they should tell you this when you book (I booked via e-mail) or if I’d read the reviews I would have known.

reviews.title: Basic with Great Location
reviews.text: My room was quite large but as we arrived late we only had time to dump our bags and get out to find some food before everything shut at 2100. After eating we had a few pints and returned to the hotel around midnight.

reviews.title: First class location and service!
reviews.text: What they also did not tell us is that the door to the main street is locked once the bar shuts so we spend five minutes trying to figure out how to get in. Fortunately I remembered that the guy who checked us in had mentioned the back door briefly. Off we trekked along the street and up the hill where we eventually found the correct door and were in.

This hotel was recommended by my Rabbie's driver. After checking in at my guest house earlier, i walked down to the city centre to this hotel - looking for a great meal. I certainly wasn't disappointed! After walking upstairs to the pub, i was warmly greeted by the bar staff. The staff were very helpful with my dinner choices and i ended up settling on the caley burger (see photo) - and was pleasantly surprised when she told me that i would get my first drink free - this includes beer!! YES!! Other than the meat pattie on the burger being a little dry, i enjoyed my meal. I watched the Rangers/Arsenal game on TV at the bar with some locals afterwards and had a great time. I would come back here for a meal next time i am in portree.
reviews.title: wonderful pub with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I would like to thank Dot and all the staff for a great 6 night stay at the Caley.
reviews.title: Enjoyed every minute at the Caledonian Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were made to feel very welcome as soon as we arrived after a very long drive.
reviews.title: Central Portree Hotel, Good Service but Hard Beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone had a genuine nice smile everyday of our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent - thoroughly recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was superb, with a good variety.
reviews.title: Friendly staff trumps minor irritations.

aka: Urquhart Caledonian Hotel Portree, Isle Of Skye, Scotland
